s1.name: Recent news
s1.subtitle: 26th March 2002: JORAM 3.0.1 available (cvs tag: joram3_0_1)
s1.p: JORAM 3.0.1 is now available for download.
This version corrects all bugs discovered by JORAM community since the release of JORAM 3.0.0. These corrections were already available in CVS repository.
s1.subtitle: 20th March 2002: JMS Test Suite released
s1.p:
A JMS Test Suite has been released under LGPL.
This suite tests JMS features. All code of the test suite is pure JMS without any dependency to JORAM.
All code is available from JORAM cvs repository. See the test suite documentation for more information.

s1.name: JORAM: Java (TM) Open Reliable Asynchronous Messaging
s1.p: JORAM incorporates a 100% pure Java implementation of JMS (Java Message Service API released by Sun Microsystem, Inc.). It provides access to a MOM (Message Oriented Middleware), built on top of the Scalagent agents based distributed platform. JORAM is a free, open source initiative.

s2.name: Specification
s2.p: JORAM provides full support to JMS 1.0.2b.

ul.li: Plus a timer for pending transacted sessions

s2.p: JORAM also implements the ASF interfaces and methods for performing JMS operations through an application server, and is integrated to JOnAS EJB platform.

s2.name: Getting involved
s2.p: Any input or personal view for improving and/or developing JORAM is welcome. JORAM, as an open source project, also welcomes external contributions. Interested? Contact us.
